Context:
* A $600,000 donation was given by The Daniels Corporation to fund a multi-purpose learning space at George Brown College's capital project Limberlost Place.
* The learning space will be named the Daniels Learning Landscape in honour of the gift.
* Limberlost Place is currently under construction and is set to open in the summer of 2024.
* The new building will house the School of Architectural Studies and the School of Computer Technology, as well as a childcare space, an area dedicated to Truth and Reconciliation, and the Brookfield Sustainability Institute (BSI).
* The Daniels Corporation's President and CEO Mitchell Cohen formally announced the donation at a cheque presentation ceremony.
* Limberlost Place will be the first institutional building of its kind in Ontario.
* The 10-storey mass-timber structure will be a model of green construction and produce as much energy as it uses by harnessing renewable energy from the surrounding environment (solar and deep-water cooling).
* Dr. Cindy Gouveia, VP Advancement, George Brown College and President, George Brown College Foundation, remarked on the positive effect of the donation.
* Limberlost Place will provide an exciting and innovative environment for the college community.
* The Daniels Corporation's CEO is Mitchell Cohen.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/George Brown College receives $600,000 donation from The Daniels Corporation for new tall-wood building Limberlost Place | George Brown College.txt

Context:
